question: The biannual Indian army commanders conference begins in __________.
explanation: On 16th April 2018, the biannual Indian army commanders conference began in New Delhi. The Biannual Army Commanders' Conference is held for 6 days. Discussions will be made on management of the extant security dynamics, mitigation of future security threats and enhancement of combat edge over potential adversaries. The opening address was delivered by Minister of State for Defence Subhash Bhamre. The conference is chaired by General Bipin Rawat, Chief of the Army Staff. Senior commanders will also discuss issues related to Army formations and Army as a whole.
